About Projects Skills CS 61B

Hi, I'm Austin.

I'm a student, teacher, software engineer, and gamer.

About Me

My name is Austin Le, and I am a 3rd year undergraduate student at UC Berkeley pursuing a B.S. in Electrical Engineering & Computer Science (EECS). As a student in the EECS Honors Degree program, I am also pursuing an additional breadth within Cognitive Science and Psychology.

I love learning, teaching, experimenting with technology, contemplating the complicated real and virtual worlds, and immersing myself in video games.

On campus, I am currently involved in multiple student groups and activities, which include:

  • Corresponding Secretary of Eta Kappa Nu, Mu chapter (the EECS Honor Society)
  • Undergraduate researcher in the Berkeley Institute of Design working with graduate student Andrew Head under Professor Bjorn Hartmann
  • A research member in the ISAACS (Immersive Semi-Autonomous Aerial Command System) team as part of the Virtual Reality at Berkeley club working in conjunction with the Berkeley Robotics and Intelligent Machines Lab
  • An undergraduate student instructor (UGSI) for CS 61B (Data Structures). My teaching ratings are publicly available on HKN's website.
  • One of the facilitators of the Analytical Thinking in League of Legends DeCal
  • An amateur dancer in AFX Dance (shoutout to the AFX JK Crew team!)

In an academic setting, I enjoy studying both the theoretical and practical sides of computer science. However, my main interests lie in the applications of computer graphics, human-computer interaction, machine learning, and artificial intelligence that help create interesting and powerful technology that augments everyday life for people. Particular applications I am fascinated by are virtual reality, augmented reality, context-aware computing, smart devices, and the Internet of Things. I'm an avid supporter of the rapid growth of virtual reality and hope to become more and more involved in its development as I continue to pursue my professional career. With my breadth in Cognitive Science and Psychology, I hope apply concepts in human perception and cognition to applications of and research being done in virtual and augmented reality.

Outside of school, I've recently gotten into developing my personal website and side projects, having been inspired by my work and co-workers this summer. I am also very passionate about online multiplayer video games and greatly enjoy what they have to offer: immersive worlds, challenging experiences, and team-oriented, strategic gameplay. I play a large variety of games, but currently mostly play League of Legends and Blade and Soul. I have a particularly weak spot for the MMORPG and RPG genres.

In Summer 2014, I interned at Google's Mountain View office on the Feedback team, and in Summer 2015, I returned to work at Google's Seattle office on the App Engine Admin API team (part of Google Cloud Platform). Next summer, I will be a Software Engineering Intern at Riot Games in Los Angeles, working within their Service Availability Initiative.

Projects

CS 184: Computer Graphics & Imaging Project 1

Basic rasterization and texturing of images.
Check out my write-up!


CS 184: Computer Graphics & Imaging Project 2

Basic tessellation, loop subdivision (upsampling) of meshes, and shading.
Check out my write-up!


League of Legends Ban Helper

This Google App Engine web application uses the Riot Games API for League of Legends and is written mainly in Golang. Users can look up a group of players to see statistics and get suggestions for bans when playing against those specific players. The application is intended for use in competitive playing environments.
Try it yourself!
